required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: HPV Prevalence in Transpersons - a Prospective Study
clinical_study.official_title: HPV Prevalence in Transpersons - a Prospective Study

brief_summary.textblock: In this study, Human Papilloma Virus (HPV) prevalence will be determined once in the urine of 200 trans people. In addition, subjects will be asked to complete a questionnaire about their sexual orientation, which is adapted from the largest published study.

detailed_description.textblock: All transpeople who visit the outpatient clinic are asked to participate in the study. After being informed and signing the Informed Consent Form, the subjects are asked to give first-void urine and fill out the survey. The urine samples are sent pseudonymously to the University of Ljubljana for analysis. The subjects will be informed about their results within 3 weeks.If the result is positive, the subjects will be offered voluntary further care in our HPV outpatient clinic. However, this will take place outside the study. The data collected there can be used for further analyses.

arm_group.description: 1x urine sampling for HPV analysis 1x survey

intervention.description: first-void urine is collected using Colli-Pee and subsequently analyzed using Anyplexâ„¢ II HPV HR Detection from Seegene.
Subjects are asked to complete a survey that includes questions about sexual orientation, hormone therapy, gender reassignment surgery, number of sexual partners, HPV vaccination, and smoking

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Transpeople
- Age over 18 years
- Sufficient knowledge of German
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age under 18 years
- Insufficient knowledge of German

eligibility.gender_description: all study participants classify themselves as transmen, transwomen, genderqueer, non-binary or other gender identity

overall_official.affiliation: Medical University of Vienna, Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology

facility.name: Institute of Microbiology and Immunology Faculty of Medicine

reference.citation: Reisner SL, Deutsch MB, Peitzmeier SM, White Hughto JM, Cavanaugh TP, Pardee DJ, McLean SA, Panther LA, Gelman M, Mimiaga MJ, Potter JE. Test performance and acceptability of self- versus provider-collected swabs for high-risk HPV DNA testing in female-to-male trans masculine patients. PLoS One. 2018 Mar 14;13(3):e0190172. doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0190172. eCollection 2018.
